summary.para: Determines whether any printers connected to this computer are shared.

returns.para: Returns standard HRESULT values, including the following:

description.para: No printers capable of being shared were found.

summary.para: Shares the Users or Public folder. If the folder is already shared, this method updates its sharing status.

param.name: dsid
param.para: One of the values that indicates the folder to share or update.

param.name: role
param.para: One of the following values that sets the access permissions of the share for the Everyone ACE. CreateShare accepts only these values.
Read-only. The contents of the folder can be read, but not altered or added to.
Read/Write. The contents of the folder can be read, changed, or added to.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

description.para: The role parameter specifies a value other than SHARE_ROLE_READER or SHARE_ROLE_CO_OWNER.

remarks.para: Running this method requires an Administrator privilege level.
If the folder named in dsid is not shared, this method shares the folder using the permission level provided in the role parameter.
If the folder named in dsid is already shared, this method updates the permissions on the share with the value provided in the role parameter.
Because as of Windows 7 the Public folder is shared through Users rather than directly, creating a share on Public causes an Server Message Block (SMB) share to be created on Users.

summary.para: Removes sharing from either the Users or Public folder.

param.name: dsid
param.para: One of the values that specifies the folder to no longer share.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Running this method requires an Administrator privilege level.

summary.para: Gets the access permissions currently associated with the User or Public folder for the Everyone access control entry (ACE).

param.name: dsid
param.para: One of the values that specifies the folder.

param.name: pRole
param.para: A pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives one of the values that indicate the sharing permissions set for the folder specified in the dsid parameter.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Queries whether the Users or Public folder is shared.

param.name: dsid
param.para: One of the values that indicates the folder whose sharing state is being checked.

returns.para: S_OK if the folder is shared; otherwise, S_FALSE.

remarks.para: Because as of Windows 7 Public is shared in-place through Users, callers should always check for the Users share first. If a share is found to exist on Users, then it follows that a share exists on Public as well.

summary.para: Stops sharing all local, shared printers connected to a computer.

summary.para: Exposes methods that set and retrieve information about a computer's default sharing settings for the Users (C:\Users) or Public (C:\Users\Public) folder. Also exposes a set of methods that allow control of printer sharing.

remarks.para: An implementation of this interface is included in the CSharingConfiguration class. Third parties do not provide their own implementation.
